description: From Ancient Greek σύμπτωμα (súmptōma, “symptom (of diseases)”) and -λογία (“study, branch of knowledge”) (i.e., symptomato- and -logy). Compare French symptomatologie.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) The science that studies the symptoms of diseases.
examples: Big Pharma has redefined the symptomatology of medical conditions in such a way as to expand enormously the market for its drugs.

entries.meaning: (countable) The aggregate of symptoms of a particular disease.
